info.title: Tokenization API
info.description: The Tokenization API is used for creating token references of payment data.

post.description:
Endpoint to create a new payment instrument.
The service will store the payment credentials and return a paymentInstrumentId which can be used as a token for referencing the credentials for any payment operation.

The storage complies with the latest PCI standards and regulations.

A payment instrument can be created either explicitly (e.g. for credit card & sepa) or implicitly as part of a preauth or debit transaction.
Payment instruments can be used for recurring payments, if the flag "recurring" is set to true.

requestBody.description: Request body to create a new paymentinstrument.

400.description: Bad request based on invalid input.

get.description:
Endpoint to receive a list of available paymentinstruments.


The following parameters can be used as filter.
- paymentInstrumentId
- merchantPaymentInstrumentId
- type
- origin
- recurring
- createdAt
- modifiedAt
Endpoint to receive a specific payment instrument referencing the paymentInstrumentId.

404.description: Not found caused by invalid input.

patch.description:
Endpoint to update an existing payment instrument referencing the paymentInstrumentId.

Can be used to refresh the verification code (CVC) for card payment instruments, e.g. in case of a recurring transaction the shopper can be forced to re-enter the CVC.

requestBody.description: Request object containing some or all of the updateable fields applicable for the type of the specified payment instrument. (CC or SEPA)

400.description: Bad request caused by invalid input.

delete.description: Endpoint to delete an existing payment instrument referencing the paymentInstrumentId.

404.description: Not found caused by invalid input.

post.description:
Service to initiate a card check which will results in a 0,00 EUR authorization.

The card check authorization can be used as an initial authorization containing the 3DS information in case the merchant only stores the payment credentials and at this point no real payment should be initiated.

requestBody.description: Request body to create a cardcheck

totalPages.description: A counter for the total pages returned.

merchantPaymentInstrumentId.description: The identifier of the paymentinstrument on your system. Created by you. limited to 100 characters.

PaymentInstrumentResponse.title: PaymentInstrumentResponse

paymentInstrumentId.description: The identifier of the paymentinstrument. Created by payengine

merchantPaymentInstrumentId.description: The identifier of the paymentinstrument on your system. Created by you. limited to 100 characters.

recurring.description: This flag indicates if this paymentinstrument can be used for recurring payments.

modifiedAt.description: Timestamp when it was last updated

customerRelationUuid.description: For TWINT only. Recognition of a returning customer.

attributes.description:
Additional attributes of this paymentinstrument. E.g. masked bank- or creditcarddata.
For Klarna we will have possibleTypes object in the response (e.g. klarna-pay-now, klarna-pay-later, klarna-slice-it)
Also we will have country, and locale.
For PPRO payments methods we could have accountHolder (if one was used for making the transaction)

PaymentInstrumentResponse.description: The paymentinstrument which has been used to process this order. note: If no paymentinstrument has been submitted, one has been created with your submitted data.

type.description: Type of the selected payment method provided by Klarna. E.g. klarna-pay-later

verification.description: The verification number of the creditcard. (CC only)

expiryMonth.description: The expiry month of the creditcard. (CC only)

expiryYear.description: The expiry year of the creditcard. (CC only)

cardHolder.description: The name of the creditcard holder. (CC only)

bankName.description: The name of the bank. (SEPA only)

bic.description: The BIC of the bank. (SEPA only)

accountHolder.description: The name of the bank account holder. (SEPA only)

billingAddress.description: The id of the billing address

shippingAddress.description: The id of the shipping address

notifyUrl.description:
Only for PayPal (mandatory) - The URL at which the instant payment notifications (IPN) are sent to notify
the merchant when the agreement is created or canceled or payments on the agreement are processed.

cardNumber.description: The Creditcard PAN used to proceed. (mandatory for creditcard, optional if a creditcard paymentInstrumentId was passed)

country.description: The country which is used. (mandatory for klarna)

currency.description: The currency which is used. (mandatory for klarna)

locale.description: The locale which is used. (mandatory for klarna)

verification.description: The verification number of the creditcard. (mandatory for creditcard, optional if a creditcard paymentInstrumentId was passed)

expiryMonth.description: The expiry month of the creditcard. Format: 01 -> january, 02 -> February, etc. (mandatory for creditcard, optional if a creditcard paymentInstrumentId was passed)

expiryYear.description: The expiry year of the creditcard. Format: 01 -> 2001, 02 -> 2002, etc. (mandatory for creditcard, optional if a creditcard paymentInstrumentId was passed)

cardHolder.description: The full name of the cardholder.

bankName.description: The name of the bank of the SEPA account.

iban.description: IBAN of the SEPA account. (mandatory for sepa, optional if a sepa paymentInstrumentId was passed)

bic.description:
BIC of the bank account. (mandatory for sepa payments with a non german iban, optional if a sepa
paymentInstrumentId was passed
optional for ideal and sofort-collecting)

accountHolder.description:
The account holders name of the bank account. (Optional parameter for PPRO payments methods
The maxLength value only for PPRO payment methods is 100.

returnUrl.description: Only for PayPal (mandatory) - The URL to which to redirect the customer when he or she accepts an agreement.

cancelUrl.description: Only for PayPal (mandatory) - The URL to which to redirect the customer when he or she cancels an agreement.

notifyUrl.description:
Only for PayPal (optional) - The URL at which the instant payment notifications (IPN) are sent to notify
the merchant when the agreement is created or canceled or payments on the agreement are processed.

billingAgreementId.description:
Only for PayPal (optional) - when PayPal Billing Agreement is created by third party provider
If billingAgreementId is provided, th–µn the fields returnUrl, cancelUrl and notifyUrl are optional and should be ignored type: string

protocolVersion.description: Protocol version as provided from google.

signedMessage.description: signed message as provided by google.

example.message: Field type is missing. Expected: string value in ['sepa', 'creditcard', 'klarna', 'paypal'].
Bad value for type. string value in ['sepa', 'creditcard', 'klarna', 'paypal'].
Field payment is missing. Expected: A valid object of type PaymentInstrumentPayment.
Bad value for payment.{unexpected_field} is unknown. Expected: A valid object of type PaymentInstrumentPayment.
Field payment.cardNumber is missing. Expected: string of length between 12 and 19 representing a valid creditcard number.
Bad value for payment.cardNumber. Expected: string of length between 12 and 19 representing a valid creditcard number.
Bad value for payment.verification. Expected: string of length between 3 and 4 representing a valid creditcard verification number.
Field payment.expiryMonth is missing. Expected: string of length 2 between '01' and '12 representing the month in a valid creditcard expiry date.
Bad value for payment.expiryMonth. Expected: string of length 2 between '01' and '12' representing the month in a valid creditcard expiry date.
Field payment.expiryMonth is missing. Expected: string of length 2 between '00' and '99' representing the year in a valid creditcard expiry date.
Bad value for payment.expiryMonth. Expected: string of length 2 between '00' and '99' representing the year in a valid creditcard expiry date.
Bad value for combination of payment.expiryMonth and payment.exiryYear. Expected: payment.expiryMonth and payment.expiryYear combined should represent a valid credit card expiry date.
Bad value for payment.cardHolder. Expected: string of length between 3 and 128 containing only alpha, whitespaces, dots, aphostrophes, dashes.
Bad value for payment.bankName. Expected: string of length between 1 and 255 containing only alpha, whitespaces, numeric characters.

Field payment.iban is missing. Expected: string representing a valid IBAN from Belgium, Germany, Estonia, Finland, France, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, the Netherlands, Austria, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Switzerland or Cyprus.

Bad value for payment.iban. Expected: string representing a valid IBAN from Belgium, Germany, Estonia, Finland, France, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, the Netherlands, Austria, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Switzerland or Cyprus.

Bad value for payment.bic. Expected: string of length 8 or 11 representing a valid BIC from Belgium, Germany, Estonia, Finland, France, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, the Netherlands, Austria, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Switzerland or Cyprus.
Bad value for payment.accountHolder. Expected: string of length between 4 and 128.
Field payment.basket is missing. Expected: An array of articles for 'basket'.
Field payment.country is missing. Expected: 2 characters as per ISO 3166-1 alpha-2. Example: DE.
Field payment.currency is missing. Expected: 3 characters as per ISO 4217. Example: EUR.
Field payment.locale is missing. Expected: 4+1 characters as per RFC 1766. Example: en-DE.
Field payment.returnUrl is missing. Expected: string representing a valid URL.
Bad value for payment.returnUrl. Expected: string representing a valid URL.
Bad value for payment.returnUrl. This field is not allowed for update.
Field payment.cancelUrl is missing. Expected: string representing a valid URL.
Bad value for payment.cancelUrl. Expected: string representing a valid URL.
Bad value for payment.cancelUrl. This field is not allowed for update.
Field payment.notifyUrl is missing. This field is required for update.
Bad value for payment.notifyUrl. Expected: string representing a valid URL.
Bad value for payment.billingAgreementId. This field is not allowed for update.
A Payment Instrument with specified id can not be found. Expected: A valid string identifier representing a Payment Instrument object between 1 and 255 characters.
Field verification is missing. Expected: string of length between 3 and 4 representing a valid creditcard verification number.
Bad value for verification. Expected: string of length between 3 and 4 representing a valid creditcard verification number.

threeDsAuthenticationId.description: Identifier of the 3DS authentication in case they should be passed together with the card check authorization to mark an initial COF transaction.

id.description: A unique transaction identifier generated by the Payengine.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when card check was initiated.

modifiedAt.description: Timestamp when card check was modified.

status.description: The status of the card check.

threeDsAuthenticationId.description: Identifier of the 3DS authentication in case they should be passed together with the card check authorization to mark an initial COF transaction.

message.example: Expected: valid identifier for card check transaction.

channel.description:
The channel (entry mode) via which the COF initial storage transaction is processed.
If not passed it defaults to ECOM.

CofContractRequest.description: The credentials on file (COF) contract object specifying the COF usage of the payment instrument. The presence of this object triggers an zero amount authorization (card check) for the given channel and type.

id.description:
Unique identifier for the COF contract of the payment instrument.
In case more than one COF type should be used for one paymentInstrument this identifier should be stored by the merchant and referenced in the payment transactions.

channel.description:
The channel (entry mode) via which the COF initial storage transaction is processed.
If not passed it defaults to ECOM.

recurringExpiry.description: Date after which no further authorizations shall be performed. This field is only required in case of an authentication for recurring payments.

recurringFrequency.description: Indicates the minimum number of days between authorizations. This field is only required in case of an authentication for recurring payments.

CofContractResponse.description: The credentials on file (COF) contract object specifying the COF usage of the payment instrument. The presence of this object triggers an zero amount authorization (card check) for the given channel and type.

CofContractTypeEnum.title: CofContractTypeEnum
CofContractTypeEnum.description:
Credential on file type:
   * `ONECLICK` - The payment instrument is persisted, recurring and can be used for oneClick payments.
   * `UNSCHEDULED` - The payment instrument is persisted, recurring and can be used for merchant initiated unscheduled orders.
   * `SCHEDULED` - The payment instrument is persisted, recurring and can be used for merchant initiated scheduled or instalments orders.

providerCode.description: Card processor code in case of an error.

providerMessage.description: Card processor message in case of an error.

CardcheckErrorDetails.description: Object containing error information in case of a FAILURE status.

ProductEnum.title: productEnum
ProductEnum.description: The product which is represented by a paymentinstrument.

ProductsBaseTypeEnum.title: ProductsBaseTypeEnum
ProductsBaseTypeEnum.description: The product used to create this order. (mandatory)

PaymentInstrumentType.title: PaymentInstrumentType
PaymentInstrumentType.description: the type of the payment instrument

MandateRequest.title: Mandate

mandateId.description: The mandateId assigned to the SEPA mandate (optional, payengine will generate the id if not present) The id needs to follow the following pattern '^[a-zA-Z0-9\-]{1,35}'

mandateText.description: Mandate text displayed to the customer (mandatory)

directDebitType.title: DirectDebitType
directDebitType.description:
The current mandate type of the direct debit type.
The mandate type can be one of the following.
FIRST: It's the first execution of the mandate SINGLE: It's used only for one execution of the mandate RECURRING: It's used for recurring mandate usage FINAL: It's the last execution of the recurring mandate

MandateRequest.description: SEPA mandate (only mandatory for SEPA orders)

BasketRequest.title: Basket

articleUrl.description: This is the url of the item in the basket

imageUrl.description: The image url of the item in the basket

discount.description: It is negative value between -999999999999999998 and -1

BasketRequest.description: Basket of the customer (only mandatory for Klarna Orders)

signedKey.description: signed key as provided by google.

CardAcquirerRoutingToEnum.title: cardAcquirerRoutingToEnum
CardAcquirerRoutingToEnum.description: Card specific parameter: The acquirer the card transaction should be routed to. This flagging can only be used if more than one acquirer is enabled for the merchant account.

ArticleTypeEnum.title: ArticleTypeEnum
ArticleTypeEnum.description: This is the type of the article. Required for Klarna and optional for all other payment methods.
